pages.title: 10 ▪Wheel of Fortune▪ כ
pages.text: Ruler of the Forces of Life

The symbolic picture stands for the perpetual motion of a fluidic universe and for the flux of human life.$(br)  Though the wheel turns, its center is fixed representing the equilibrium therein.$(br)  Burning in red around the wheel, the letters T-A-R-O (spelling TAROT or ROTA, meaning 'wheel' or 'way'), counterchanged with the letters of the unpronounceable name - הוהי -  representative of the Four Elements of Creation, weaved through all.

The same intention is reflected by the four figures, one for each Element, each with a book on top of clouds.$(br)  The person stands for Air, the eagle for Water, the Ox for Earth, and the Lion for Fire.$(br)  The scene reminds us of the mythic wheel of the Goddess of Luck that turns and ultimately points to an unexpected position everytime; a graceful illustration of the interchange between destiny and chance.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Change of circumstances.$(br)  Events taking place of their own accord, without conscious control.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Taking hold of your destiny.$(br)  Discovering the causes behind events.
